events.name: Chef Meetup - Habitat & Windows Automation
events.description: The team from Chef is on the road helping people learn about Chef for Windows & Habitat.  They will be in Singapore for a Hands-on with Chef and Hands-on with Habitat workshop. We host this free workshop in cooperation with the PowerShell meetup. Seats are strictly limited to 40 attendees. Register here and safe your seat now! IMPORTANT You need to register on their website. Do not RSVP here on meetup, as this will not reserve your seat. Go to this website and register: https://pages.chef.io/ChefMeetup_Singapore_RSVP.html WHAT IS HABITAT? Habitat is Chef’s open-source project for application automation.  It simplifies container management by packaging applications in a compact, atomic, and easily auditable format that makes it easier to deploy your application on various container runtimes.  It also helps you run stateful application services (think Redis, Mongo, etc) on cloud instances, VMs, or bare metal. Find out more at habitat.sh. WHO SHOULD ATTEND? You are an early adopter. You want to use leading edge technology and embark with Chef on the journey to invent the new way of managing and deploying applications? Then this hands on day is for you. This will be a hands-on workshop aimed at anyone involved in building, deploying, or managing applications.  You may be a developer or may come from an infrastructure background. You may currently be working with container technology or a microservices architecture (or planning to).   Habitat helps simplify the processes required to build, deploy, and manage your applications and, if you’re already using containers, even makes containers more awesome.
events.location: Microsoft Operations Pte Ltd. | Floor 22, #22-01 One Marina Boulevard | Singapore 018989

events.name: TechLadies Go to UNited We Hack!
events.description:
TechLadies is a community partner for UNited We Hack. Let's form teams to attend! They welcome people of all skill levels so don't be shy, we're here for each other! Also, you get a 100% discount code to tickets when you join the TechLadies fb group at https://www.facebook.com/groups/techladiescode/

See you next week?

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Globally, women’s earnings are, on average, 24 percent less than men’s, and even in developed countries —where policies are increasingly supportive of female employment— women on average earn just half as much income as men over their lifetimes. The contrast is even starker in developing countries.

How can we use innovation to benefit women financially and economically around the world?

This April 29-30, 2017 at General Assembly, the Singapore Committee for UN Women and AngelHack are bringing back UNited We Hack. In 2017, we will look into barriers preventing female entrepreneurship, and we want you to take up the 2-day challenge! Health, Safety, Economic Empowerment, and Culture – Take your pick and hack a solution. This year we’re adding on more exciting events including a General Assembly masterclass session, and a screening of the award-winning documentary CODE: Debugging the Gender Gap.
events.location: General Assembly, Level 3, 8 Claymore Hill, Space Mob, Singapore 229572

events.name: IMDA / IET Presents - Faraday Challenge 2017
events.description:
What is IET Faraday?
The IET Faraday programme has been developed by the Institution of Engineering and Technology, Europe’s largest professional organisation in the field. Our aim is to introduce a new generation to the sheer excitement of science, technology and engineering.
Discover how engineers influence our world…
The IET Faraday materials give a real insight into what it’s like to be a scientist, technologist or engineer working at the cutting edge of technology. You’ll find out about the problems that engineers face and the technologies behind their solutions.
You can check out an introduction video here.
Workshop Details
We will be organising participants into 6 groups of 6 students each and teach them how to make use of engineering principles to solve an interesting problem. This time round we will be building a table tennis server. Your child will learn how to work together as a team and build the table tennis server. Each team will be given virtual currencies to buy materials to build their prototype.


Adminstrations
All participants will receive a special certificate of participations and the winning team will receive a certificate of achievement as well as attractive prizes for all team members.
Tickets are only required for children. Parents DO NOT need any tickets. Parents who would like to leave their children with us will have to sign an indemity form. Parents can also stay behind to watch at the sidelines.
Refreshments will be available for the children throughout the session.
events.location: Marina Bay Sands Exhibition Hall C, Level 1, Singapore 018971
